TrekMe plr.devs@gmail.com
Open navigation drawer Close navigation drawer
Map My maps Create My trails Excursions GPS+ Recording stats Import a map Receive or send Settings Shop About https://github.com/p-lr/TrekMe/blob/master/Readme.md#summary Click BACK again to exit You must be connected to internet to create a map TrekMe absolutely needs internal storage access, because it stores maps and other data there. Don\'t worry, it will never attempt to access your private data.\n\nYou can give TrekMe this permission in your Android settings, in Applications > TrekMe. Warning Solution There is something wrong with your SD card: we can\'t write to it.\nThis has nothing to do with TrekMe, and it won\'t be able to download maps or save changes. Your SD card is only accessible as read-only. This means we can\'t write to it and TrekMe won\'t be able to download maps or save changes. Please enable storage permission from settings Close Cancel Start I understand new
Select a map source. Center on your position using this button Select the area to download IGN maps are available with TrekMe Extended Go to shop Check pending… Free trial Your subscription to TrekMe Extended must end before you can select the IGN option.

It can be a permission issue. Please check that all permissions of TrekMe are granted, and reboot your phone, if necessary. A download is already pending. Please wait for the current download to complete before starting a new one. An unexpected api missing error occurred. Please update TrekMe. This map is not repairable.

Save map Saving a map will create an archive from it. You\'ll choose the destination folder of that archive. Later, you can restore a map from an archive using the import menu.\n\nThe progress will appear in a notification. Map successfully archived Archiving Saving the map %s in progress
Calibrated Not calibrated Calibration error Calibration point saved Projection successfully changed Couldn\'t set projection :(
Thumbnail image Change thumbnail image Calibration Projection Number of calibration points Define calibration points
Map Name Size Compute size Computing.. Save

Manage tracks Follow a track
Tracks manage Tracks Settings The file you chose is not in a supported format. Supported extensions are : GPX (tracks, routes, waypoints) Google Maps directions (XML, JSON) Enter the name of the track Rename See on the map File name Import result\n Routes: %s \n Waypoints: %s Oops.. something went wrong during the import Track visibility Track color Select a color Apply Variant Normal Light Dark Add track button Confirm track removal
Show speed Add elements Marker Landmark Beacon Measure distance Distance on track Show orientation Show GPS data Delete landmark Move landmark Lock on position Awaiting GPS… Landmark Beacon Landmark Move Delete marker? km/h mph km m ml You haven\'t created nor imported any track yet. You can import a gpx track downloaded from a website (or a recording of your own) using the import button below. To open this map, your TrekMe Extended subscription with IGN option must be active. To open this map, your TrekMe Extended subscription must be active. This map appears to be empty Go to shop Unknown map source. The map configuration is incorrect. Center on position button Compass Your location is outside this map Set the elevation fix Fix The fix value is added to the elevation from the GPS This map has at least one beacon. As a result, the app needs to collect location data even when the app is closed or not in use.\n\nCurrently, the authorization isn\'t granted. Press on the track to follow The track-follow service is already running. Do you want to stop it? When following a track, your distance to the track is checked and if you move more than (say) 50m away from the track, you get notified with a sound and vibration.\n\nThe alert threshold can be changed in the settings.
Sorry, no itinerary app found
Marker edit Beacon edit Name Beacon extent Radius Unit WGS84 coordinates Projected coordinates Comment Save Changes saved A beacon notifies you when you get close enough to it. The vicinity area is indicated with a dashed line. The beacon radius is 100m by default, but can be changed.\nThe alert is a sonar sound effect and a vibration. \n\nWhen a map has beacons, a service runs in the background. The purpose of this service is to alert you when you get close to a beacon.
FragmentRecording My trails Location is currently disabled. Please enable it on your device. GPX recordings Import files Some files could not be deleted Location service Started Stopped Paused Choose a map The track is being imported into the map A track is being restored An error occurred while importing the track The GPX recording will probably be interrupted, because battery optimization is enabled for TrekMe.\nA GPX recording is actually an Android service which runs in the background. However, some devices put a hard limit on the number of background services allowed to run.\nIt\'s common for Android to abruptly stop a service, if it considers that stopping it would extend battery life. In the case of a GPX recording, it\'s reasonable to consume a bit of power while you\'re aware of it. The track-follow service will probably be interrupted, because battery optimization is enabled for TrekMe.\nThe track-follow service runs in the background. However, some devices put a hard limit on the number of background services allowed to run.\nIt\'s common for Android to abruptly stop a service, if it considers that stopping it would extend battery life. When following a track, it\'s reasonable to consume a bit of power while you\'re aware of it. See solution Solution Go to your device settings -> \"Apps\" then \"TrekMe\". Inside the Battery setting, you should see a menu \"Battery optimization\" or similar. You should disable the battery optimization. Track imported in %1$d maps Information TrekMe collects location data during the GPX recording, even when the app is closed or not in use. In order to do that, the location permission must be set to "allow all the time" or equivalent.\n\nThis location data isn\'t shared with anyone, and gpx files are stored locally on your device. In order to regularly check your distance to the followed track, TrekMe needs to collect location data in the background, even when the app is closed or not in use. In order to do that, the location permission must be set to "allow all the time" or equivalent.\n\nThis location data isn\'t shared with anyone.
Successfully imported in %1$d files Couldn\'t import %1$s Edit recording name Import the recording into a map Share a recording Show the elevation profile Delete a recording Elevation profile Distance Cumulated upward elevation Cumulated downward elevation Total duration Average speed Multi selection mode You have no trails yet. To get started, you can record yourself from any map, or: Import an existing trail Look for a trail
This GPX file contains no elevations. TrekMe can\'t show the elevation profile. This GPX is either empty of an error occurred. You must be online to continue, as this feature uses a web service to check for elevations. The elevation service is temporarily unavailable :( TrekMe couldn\'t check elevations for this track. The service might be temporarily unavailable, or the area isn\'t covered. Computing elevations… Elevation top icon Elevation bottom icon Elevation bottom-top icon Elevation data accuracy Elevation data comes from the GPS, with medium accuracy. Elevation data comes from IGN\'s RGE Alti database, with great accuracy. Elevation data comes from an unknown source. If the source is the GPS, the accuracy is medium.

Map creation Zoom on location Choose layer Overlay layers Use a track Map configuration Decrement min level Increment min level Decrement max level Increment max level WmtsFragment Minimum zoom Maximun zoom Map size Map too big It is advised to download only the area that you need, or to adapt zoom levels. Checking module.. Available with TrekMe Extended 1 year, 7d free trial Please wait a few minutes, payment is pending Unable to check your module Purchase Download Download started. See the status in your notifications. It looks like there\'s an issue with either IGN servers, which generally solves itself after a few hours. Your location is out of supported bounds for this map It looks like there\'s a temporary outage of the map provider, which generally solves itself after a few hours. We\'re having trouble fetching required data. If your internet connection is working properly, we\'ll hopefully fix the outage soon. Settings General pref_starton Start TrekMe on the map list the last map pref_measurement_system Measurement system Metric system Imperial system (miles) Root folder pref_download_location Selected folder Maps pref_map_max_scale Max scale Magnifying factor pref_map_magnifying Alert threshold - track follow pref_track_follow pref_rotation_mode Rotation mode Rotate only when showing orientation None Free pref_change_scale_when_centering Define scale when centering on position pref_show_scale_indicator Show scale indicator pref_scale_zoom_when_centered Zoom when centered (current: %1$s)
Map sharing Stop Receive Send Searching for another device..\nThis step can take a few minutes Device found. Awaiting connection.. Connected. Loading should start shortly. Load in progress Something went wrong (%1$s).\nMaybe retry. Successfully loaded %1$s You need to enable Wifi on your device to use this feature, even if there is no network or Hotspot. https://github.com/peterLaurence/TrekMe/blob/master/Readme.md#map-sharing Warning Wifi image Happy image Sad image
User manual There\'s a complete user manual where you\'ll find everything you should know about TrekMe. Rate the app Feedback and suggestions See manual Do you like the application? You have ideas of improvement, or some issues I can help you with, send me and email. Contribute to making TrekMe more popular, and encourage me to add more features. Tell me about your issue and I\'ll do my best to help you. Privacy policy We respect your privacy and will never share private data such as your location to any third parties. See the %1$s. privacy policy Send mail Thumb-up button Thumb-down button
GPS Pro Connect your external GPS using Bluetooth https://github.com/peterLaurence/TrekMe/blob/master/doc/gpspro/doc.md If you have an external GPS with bluetooth, you can connect it to TrekMe and use it instead of the internal GPS of your device. This is especially useful when your activity (aeronautic, professional topography, ..) requires better precision and updating your position at a higher frequency than every second. Compatible devices This list isn\'t exhaustive. All GPS emitting NMEA 0183 sentences over Bluetooth are supported. Searching bluetooth devices Bluetooth is disabled TrekMe currently isn\'t allowed to connect to Bluetooth devices. You can change that in Android settings, in Applications > TrekMe. Bluetooth isn\'t supported on this device Select active GPS PREVIOUSLY CONNECTED DEVICES Internal GPS Bluetooth GPS connection lost. Will retry.. Settings for device Generate GPS diagnosis diagnosis Diagnosis is running… File saved An error occurred while saving the file GPS diagnosis Your GPS emissions will be recorded for 10s.\nThis is useful when the connection with TrekMe isn\'t working properly, as it contains information that will further help making TrekMe compatible with your GPS.\n\nYou\'ll be asked for saving the diagnosis on your device. Then, please send it at plr.devs@gmail.com - I\'ll have a look and give you feedback. Diagnosis done. Received %1$d sentences.\nSave file? The previous diagnosis didn\'t record any activity from the GPS.
ShopFragment TrekMe Extended 7d of free trial Maps Download OSM HD maps, with a twice better resolution than standard and better readable texts With IGN option IGN maps Topographic IGN maps Satellite view Overlay slopes for mountain activities, cadastre, roads, paths and trails Advanced features Be alerted when you move more than (say) 50m from a track. The alert threshold can be changed Add beacons to alert you when you get close to specific locations No ads Create a map from a gpx track Quick center on a track from tracks management screen Set an elevation fix in the GPS statistics panel Unlock the 17th level for OSM maps Exclusive features will be added You own this module Purchase pending… Temporary unavailable %1$dd of free trial 1 year 1 month The IGN map server is sometimes slow. During IGN map creation, tiles appear slowly or not at all. When this happens, it is advised to retry later in the day. PS MANAGE SUBSCRIPTION https://play.google.com/store/account/subscriptions
